title: Defense Contractor/Senior Lead Recruiter Consultant
description: We support many different DISA, Army, Marine, Navy, NATO and Joint coalition customers globally in places such as Germany, Belgium, Bahrain, Afghanistan, Iraq, Jordan, Kuwait, Korea and Egypt. We know how to navigate the complexities of living and working in these OCONUS environments. We also support combatant commands such as NORTHCOM, SOUTHCOM, CENTCOM and PACOM with solutions and services that require rapid response to requirements on a moment’s notice. We have a long history of supporting immediate reaction and response teams as well as supporting short-notice deployments of highly-specialized teams to address cyber security, networking, systems, command center and communications systems and services requirements.

title: Defense Contractor Lead
description: Analyze and deploy personel overseas to maintain military vehicles. Such as(Mine-Resistant Ambush Protected Vehicles) to conduct initial inspections and perform vehicle repairs, sustainment maintenance, retrofits, instruction, and modifications to all Marine Corps Cougar MRAP vehicles in Afghanistan, Kuwait and the Continental United States for the DOD. Provide market knowledge and qualified candidates to Contacts/Proposal teams which would be utilized to acquire new business, contracts and revenue streams within the government sector (Civilian/Defense/Intelligence). Identify, interview, evaluate and select qualified candidates for (OCONUS/CONUS) contract positions. Half our employees have a military background, and more than 70 percent hold a government security clearance. As a leading provider of innovative technology services and solutions for the nation's defense, security, space, and intelligence communities; we hold nearly 1,000 active contracts with more than 40 different government agencies.

title: Recruiter/Business Developer
description: Developed a marking plan for recruitment with corporations. Implemented promotional events. Acted as liaison between the admissions office and the HR department. Negotiated contracts with HR departments in various companies, to hire students and recruit prospective students to ITT Technical Institute. Spearheaded recruitment methods with governmental agencies such as the FBI and CIA to hire students and coordinated a numerous campus/company events, departmental events. Coordinated recruitment strategies with the U.S. military and the Department of Education. Planned, organized, and executed working relationships with select employment agencies.

title: Govenment Advocacy and Internships
description: Worked as Public Affairs Associate for Utah Rivers Counsel against wasteful tax spending for Utah. Advocated for additional oil shale development and conducted policy research for legislative committee of Utah, and other grassroots, non-profit organizations. Assisted to develop a system and strategy to inform public on relevant legislative issues for The Unconventional Fuels Conference. Spearheaded, Greek grassroots lobbying on Capitol Hill for religious freedom in Turkey, with the Greek Embassy. Worked as translator, and interned as a U.S. liaison for 2002 Salt Lake City Winter Olympic Games. Interned for the 2004 Athens Summer Olympic Games; supported Consular Affairs Officers and American Services Officers. Successfully lobbied state legislators on behalf of Motion Picture Association of Utah, to establish The Motion Picture Incentive Fund; program that offers tax breaks incentives to promote motion picture and television productions in Utah. 06/2006-10/2006.
name: John Yanni Tsilis
